reason: Two minor clarifications: (1) The tetrahedron/6j suppression (1/sqrt(j)) is pedagogical - the BLM paper (Draft.tex line 556) explicitly notes the tetrahedron diagram does NOT actually appear in the model due to line orientation constraints. The first non-melonic diagram that actually appears is the cube/12j with (log j)/j suppression. (2) The prefactor uses j^{3/2} where the exact Ponzano-Regge formula has (j+1/2)^{3/2}; correct only to leading asymptotic order. Neither issue affects mathematical validity.
